topic.title: What's new in Release 15.2
topic.p: For Mingle onsite customers, please review the upgrade instructions before moving to Mingle 15.2

note.item: All of the features below are already available for our Mingle in the cloud customers.

section.title: Dependency Management for Mingle Plus
section.p: Mingle's new dependency management feature provides end-to-end visibility of all dependencies within a program. Team members can raise, accept, and resolve cross-team dependencies through peer-to-peer dialogue within Mingle.

section.title: Add/Remove Rows to the Grid View
section.p: Mingle now allows you to add and remove rows on the grid view in the same way as you add and remove columns.

section.title: Copy Card within the Same Project
section.p: Copying cards within the same project can help when you are bulk creating similar cards, splitting a story, or for many other reasons.

section.title: Improved Viewing and Downloading of Attachments
section.p: Based on feedback from users, we widened the attachments container to show the full length of file names. We've also provided individual action buttons to view or download each file.

section.title: Improved Team Member Property Load Times
section.p: Instead of immediately loading all team members when viewing a team member property, Mingle will now load your 5 most recently selected users with an option to load more.

section.title: Exposed Timestamps in Events API
section.p: Every change event in Mingle's Event API will not include a timestamp (mingle_timestamp). If you are doing any reporting outside of Mingle, having the timestamp will provide you with more accurate data.

section.title: Improved Security of Mingle
section.p: We care about your security. We've made a number of security enhancements at all levels of Mingle.

section.title: Bug fixes
section.p: The following bugs have been fixed with 15.2:

bullets.item: Fixed issue where Mingle was not displaying truncated property names correctly.
Fixed issue where macros were not validating dates allowing users to enter a date far into the future, which could cause performance issues.
Fixed issue of overwriting existing attachments with the same name when copying a card.
Fixed issue of anonymous users having write access in certain areas of a project.
Fixed print formatting issues when printing cards.
Fixed issue where CKEditor was not loading in edit mode.
Fixed issue in CKEditor where bold button was not disabling properly.
Fixed issue where card descriptions were not properly formatted when exporting to Excel.
Fixed issue in card full view murmurs where tagged users were not highlighted in blue.
